questions.question: All elements are identified by their __________ and are marked up using either start tags and end tags or self-closing tags
questions.correct-answer-display: Correct Answer!The tagName property returns the tag name of the element. In HTML, the returned value of the tagName property is always in UPPERCASE.
questions.wrong-answer-display: Wrong Answer! You have choosen the Wrong Answer.

questions.question: The __________ element represents a span of text that is isolated from its surroundings for the purposes of bidirectional text formatting
questions.correct-answer-display: Correct Answer!bdi stands for Bi-directional Isolation. This element is useful when embedding user-generated content with an unknown directionality
questions.wrong-answer-display: Wrong Answer! You have choosen the Wrong Answer.

questions.question: A ____________ element must have a start tag but must not have an end tag
questions.correct-answer-display: Correct Answer!The command tag is new in HTML5 and specifies a normal command with an action.
questions.wrong-answer-display: Wrong Answer! You have choosen the Wrong Answer.

questions.question: Which type attribute of input element sets the element’s value to a string representing a number?
questions.correct-answer-display: Correct Answer!The input element with a type attribute whose value is “range” represents an imprecise control for setting the element’s value to a string representing a number
questions.wrong-answer-display: Wrong Answer! You have choosen the Wrong Answer.

questions.question: The World Wide Web’s markup language has always been HTML.
questions.correct-answer-display: Correct Answer!The World Wide Web’s markup language has always been HTML. HTML was primarily designed as a language for semantically describing scientific documents, although its general design and adaptations over the years have enabled it to be used to describe a number of other types of documents.
questions.wrong-answer-display: Wrong Answer! You have choosen the Wrong Answer.

questions.question: Which of the following type attributes of input element defines control for entering a telephone number?
questions.correct-answer-display: Correct Answer!The input element with a type attribute whose value is “tel” represents a one-line plain-text edit control for entering a telephone number.
questions.wrong-answer-display: Wrong Answer! You have choosen the Wrong Answer.

questions.question: Which element represents a control for generating a public-private key pair?
questions.correct-answer-display: Correct Answer!The keygen element represents a control for generating a public-private key pair and for submitting the public key from that key pair.
questions.wrong-answer-display: Wrong Answer! You have choosen the Wrong Answer.

questions.question: Which element represents marked or highlighted text for reference purposes?
questions.correct-answer-display: Correct Answer!The mark element represents a run of text in one document marked or highlighted for reference purposes, due to its relevance in another context.
questions.wrong-answer-display: Wrong Answer! You have choosen the Wrong Answer.

questions.question: Which element(s) represents a section of a document that links to other documents?
questions.correct-answer-display: Correct Answer!The nav element represents a section of a page that links to other pages or to parts within the page: a section with navigation links.
questions.wrong-answer-display: Wrong Answer! You have choosen the Wrong Answer.

questions.question: Which of the following element marks the ruby text component of a ruby annotation?
questions.correct-answer-display: Correct Answer!The rt element is the markup for ruby text.
questions.wrong-answer-display: Wrong Answer! You have choosen the Wrong Answer.
